Kural_Info.Chapter: பெரியாரைத் துணைக்கோடல் (Seeking the Aid of Great Men)
Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: இடிப்பாரை இல்லாத ஏமரா மன்னன் கெடுப்பா ரிலானுங் கெடும்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The king, who is without the guard of men who can rebuke him, will perish, even though there be no one to destroy him.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A king is depicted walking alone and confidently on a grand path. He has no counselors around him to offer criticism ('இடிப்பார் இல்லாத').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The path, which appears solid at first, is revealed to be an illusion over a deep chasm. The king, unguarded by critical advice ('ஏமரா'), is about to step into the void and perish under his own power.
Layered_Composition.Background: There are no visible enemies anywhere ('கெடுப்பார் இலானும்'). The destruction is entirely self-inflicted due to the lack of guidance. The landscape is empty and desolate.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A king who lacks the protection of critical advisors will destroy himself, even without any external enemies.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The path that is actually a chasm is a metaphor for the unseen dangers that a king without counsel walks into. The absence of enemies emphasizes that the ruin is from within.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A flat, deceptive light on the path. The chasm below is filled with an ominous darkness. The overall palette is muted and somber.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A shot from the side, revealing to the viewer the true nature of the path that the king cannot see.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, cinematic, with a focus on creating a sense of impending doom.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Deceptive lighting that makes the path look safe, contrasting with the dark truth.

Cultural_Anchors: A king without critics ('இடிப்பார் இல்லாத மன்னன்')

Negative_Prompt: king with many friends, a solid path, enemies attacking, text artifacts, cartoonish.
